W-Br Yes?
M-Au 65l just received an e-mail from a senior executive at Destra Incorporated. It's about their visit to our headquarters next month. They have a special request for the itinerary.
W-Br I’m almost done with it, but 65l guess I can shift some plans around. 66What did the client ask for?
M-Au 66They want to go on a hike nearby. They've heard how beautiful it is here during this time of the year.
W-Br I know a good hiking spot. But 67IMI have to cancel one of the other activities in order to fit it in. Maybe the visit to the art museum?
M-Au Good idea. The basketball game is usually more popular than the museum.

M: Hello, I’m Steven from Home Appliance Mart. Q1 I’m here to install the UHD television that you ordered last week.
W: Yes, come right this way. We would like to mount the television on this wall. We plan to use it for presentations and training seminars.
M: Oh, no. Q2 It looks like I forgot the tools that I need to screw the television to the wall mount. I’m sorry. I’ll have to come back tomorrow morning.
W: Oh, that’s all right. Q3 However, please call me before you come tomorrow to make sure that someone is in the office to meet you.

question.text: What are the speakers mainly discussing?
What is the problem?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Hello, Mr. Morgan. This is Debra. Q1 We have a bit of a problem. The person that was supposed to give the keynote speech next week is sick. So we need to find a replacement. Would you be able to do it?
M: I’ll be out of town for the next four days on business and when I get back I’ll be quite busy.
W: I see. Q2 The board of directors would love to have you do the speech. They really liked it last time you delivered it.
M: Q3 Thanks, but I’ll have to pass on it. I just have too much on my plate at the moment. If I had some more time to prepare, I would have considered it.
W: OK, I understand. I’ll let the board know. I hope you have a safe trip.
M: Thanks for your understanding, Debra.

question.text: What is the problem?
choices: (A) The person who was supposed to give the speech is sick.
(B) The person who was giving the speech said they don’t want to.
(C) There is no keynote speech anymore.

answer.text: (A) The person who was supposed to give the speech is sick.

question.text: What does the woman ask the man?
choices: (A) She asks him to find someone to do the speech.
(B) She says she will deliver the speech.
(C) She asks him to deliver the keynote speech.
(D) She says the board is not happy.

answer.text: (C) She asks him to deliver the keynote speech.

question.text: What does the man imply when he says “Thanks, but I’ll have to pass on it”?
choices: (B) He doesn’t want to deliver the speech,
(c) He will talk to the board of directors.

answer.text: (B) He doesn’t want to deliver the speech,

Transcript:
M: We finally were able to pump all of the water from the basement today. Unfortunately, a lot of our inventory was damaged by the water.
W: I’ve never seen a flood occur so fast like that. Because of the damaged inventory, we won’t be able to be open for a few days.
M: Well, at least it didn’t happen over the weekend when no one was in the office. The damage could have been much worse.
W: That’s true. I heard from our supplier and they said they can restock our storage room this Friday. I guess we’ll just have to wait patiently until then.

M: Hey Judy, Q1 did you see the new offices the company built? They look fantastic.

M: I know we had some slow years, but the last five years everyone has worked so hard and now it’s finally paying off.

M: I agree with you. But it is nice to see it finally paying off. I can’t wait to move into my new office!

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
Sam’s Salon is committed to helping aid the homeless. If you have been a resident of Freewater over the last year, you have surely noticed the pop up salon on the corner of Cornwall Avenue and Dupont. This pop up is not for hipsters though, it’s for the homeless. Sam’s Salon has been volunteering to give the homeless in our community shampoos, shaves, and haircuts in order to help them get back on their feet. To further this effort, Sam’s Salon is having a Saturday only haircut special, where half of all sales will go to help the local homeless shelter. This is great opportunity to show that you care, support a local business, and to get a darn good haircut.

question.text: What is indicated in the article?
choices: (A) Sam’s Salon is just starting to interact with the homeless.
(B) Sam’s Salon has been involved with improving the lives of homeless people.
(C) Sam’s Salon employs a high quality manicurist.
(D) Sam’s Salon is trying to make extra money for coloring and perms.

answer.text: (D) Sam’s Salon is trying to make extra money for coloring and perms.

question.text: Look at the graphic. What is true about the benefit?
choices: (A) People should get their hair colored another time.
(C) Most men will choose a trim.

answer.text: (C) Most men will choose a trim.

question.text: How much does Sam’s Salon charge the homeless for a shampoo, shave, and a haircut?

answer.explanation: W-Am: Welcome everyone. 74 I'll be taking you on a guided tour of the Lakeside Art Museum today. In the nineteenth century, the breathtaking scenery and mild climate attracted many artists to this area. That's why you'll find such an extensive collection of oil paintings from that era. Before we start, 75 I see many of you have cameras out. Please note that this is a private collection. Don't worry, though, you can buy postcards with images of the paintings. So thanks in advance for your cooperation. 76 Later this afternoon, make sure to visit our cafe located on the outdoor terrace, where you can enjoy a delicious lunch. So let's begin.

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
Thank you all for coming to this meeting on such short notice. It has come to my attention that the Human Resource Department has been overwhelmed lately with reports about messes in the common areas. As your regional manager, I feel it is my responsibility to take ownership of this problem before it gets completely out of control. Just so everybody is clear, the common areas include the kitchen, the foyer, recreation room A, and lounge c on the second floor. I don’t know who is responsible for this recent run of uncleanliness, but from now on we are going to assign a staff member to monitor the condition of each area and sign off on it at the end of every day. We will do this until I feel everyone has learned to respect the space. Be sure to check the schedule to see which area you will be responsible for.

question.text: Who is speaking to the staff?
Look at the graphic. Which employee was given responsibility for two common areas on the same day?
What is indicated in the meeting?
choices: (B) The staff will need to work weekends,
(D) There have been a lot of complaints.

answer.text: (D) There have been a lot of complaints.

answer.explanation: Hi. My name is Sonya Pike. Q1 I ordered a jacket from your store two weeks ago. Q2&3 Unfortunately, it’s too small, and I’d like to return it for a refund. answer.explanation: I’d like to start off today's meeting by thanking you for taking our survey. Q1 Here at R&M Auto Factory, we're committed to employee satisfaction. We received a lot of suggestions for improving our factory’s cafeteria, so let’s take a look at those results now. As you can see, we’d all like a larger dining area, but we just can’t afford an expansion right now. Q2 We can, however, address the second most popular suggestion, so we’ll start working on that immediately. And, as a token of our thanks, Q3 everyone who filled out the survey will receive a voucher for a free lunch.

answer.explanation: (M-Au): Hello. Thank you for calling the Museum of Folk Arts. This month's featured exhibition is a diverse collection of carpets and rugs from around the world. We offer two guided tours of this exhibit daily. Q1 Visitors will learn about the history of carpet making and the importance of this art form through the years. Q2 We recommend that large groups of more than ten people call in advance to make reservations for a group tour. Q3 For more information please go to our Web site at MuseumFA.org, where you can see a detailed schedule of all our upcoming events. Thank you.

question.text: What will visitors learn about on the tour?
Who should make a reservation?
According to the message, what can listeners do on the Web site?
All posters and flyers must be removed from the bulletin board ------ 48 hours after the event has occurred.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: The cost of round-trip air transportation is included ___ the nine-day cruise package.

answer.explanation: Be included in st

question.text: Since its repair, the central heating system in the Rayburn Building is now in ___ order.

answer.explanation: Be inn working order = Be working

question.text: Ms. Pieraccini had ___ finished editing the budget report when she noticed an error In the title page.

answer.explanation:
Nearly = Almost
"Nearly" is the only answer that comes before verbs.

question.text: Restaurant critic Pierre Dunn remarked that the food served at Druss’ Kitchen has never been anything ___ superb.

answer.explanation: Anything but = Not at all

question.text: At Correia Electronics, we are  ______ researching appliance technology.

answer.explanation: Need adv to modify for verb "research"

question.text: Seats will be assigned on a first-come, first- served basis, so it would be best to arrive no ___ than 11:00 A.M.

answer.explanation: No + comparative adjective + than = The maximum number or amount.

question.text: Renters are most excited about the ------ kitchens in the upgraded units.

answer.explanation: Article (the) + adj/V3-ed + noun (kitchens)

question.text: Management believes that stagnant sales of the Pondhopper luggage line is a result of the ___ advertising campaign that was launched last quarter.

answer.explanation: Inadequate = Not enough

question.text: The Empire Theatre box office will stop selling tickets fifteen minutes ___ the beginning of the show.

answer.explanation: We use "before + time" to show time.

question.text: This month, Mr. Choi has excelled at ------- processing incoming orders.

answer.explanation: Vocabulary question. Based on the meaning to choose the right answer.

question.text: lolana Dance Troupe stands out because the group knows ………………….to integrate a variety of dance styles.

answer.explanation: Structure: Know how to do sth

question.text: _____ the difference between the two brands is small, most consumers purchase the cheaper one.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> B

question.text: Not far _____ the train station lies Starlight Park, which is a popular destination for tourists and locals alike.

answer.explanation: - (Not) far from + location

question.text: Using a checklist is an ___ way to make plans.

answer.explanation: (A) The adjective “effective” modifies “way”. Choices (B) and (C) are nouns. Choice (D) is an adverb.

question.text: Preparing a budget encourages an executive to ___ several options before deciding on a course of action.

answer.explanation: Examine = Check = Consider

question.text: Mr. Benito received the notice ___ January 5.

answer.explanation: (A) Use the idiomatic “on” with dates. Choice (B) means “inside”. Choice (C) indicates location. Choice (D) indicates destination.

question.text: ___ the last decade, Louellen Hospital has been recognized for exemplary patient care and progressive technology.

answer.explanation:
"Along" goes with "with" at the start of a sentence.
Beside = Next to
We do not use present perfect tense with "toward + time period".
Therefore, we choose "throughout".

question.text: Consumers are advised to use caution when applying this product ___ fabrics that have been dyed by hand.

answer.explanation: Apply st to st

question.text: Aurora Furnishings is finding it difficult to make a profit in its _____competitive market.

answer.explanation:
The blank precedes a noun phrase with adj + noun, so an adverb is suitable to modify the adjective
=> Choose C

question.text: Passengers on the aircraft are asked to secure ___ belongings during take off and landing.

answer.explanation: The answer comes before a noun so we use "their".

question.text: ......the most challenging aspect of accepting a new position is negotiating a salary that is both fair and satisfying.

answer.explanation:
- Need to fill in a first adverb. C, D are wrong.
- Based on the meaning of the answer A.

question.text: Visitors are reminded ___ name tags at all times.

answer.explanation: (A) “Reminded” requires the infinitive. Choice (B) is the simple form. Choice (C) is the past participle. Choice (D) is the progressive form.

question.text: Kanelek Limited and Evensohn LLC have entered a strategic partnership to …………………their market share.

answer.explanation:
After "to" need to choose a verb infinitive
=> D

question.text: Pens and stationery___kept in the top drawer.

answer.explanation: (A) The plural verb “are” agrees with the plural subject “pens” and “stationery”. Choices (B), (C), and (D) are all singular forms.

question.text: All expenses must be approved___the department head at the beginning of each month.

answer.explanation: (A) In a passive-voice sentence, “by” introduces the performer of the action. Choices (B), (C), and (D) are not used in this position in a passive-voice sentence.

question.text: Library patrons who fail to return an item by the due dat ___ a fee.

answer.explanation:
Charge sb st = Make sb pay st
The answer is in its passive voice so we choose "will be charged".

question.text: Mr. Tanaka has decided to employ a payroll service because it is becoming too difficult to manage the payroll accounts -------.

answer.explanation: This sentence is full of elements so it is impossible to fill in the blank with the subject, object or adjective. Excluding those options, only the reflexive pronoun "himself" is justified.

question.text: Supervisors ___ have questions about the new expense report process should contact the budget office for assistance.

answer.explanation: The subject of the relative clause are people so we use "who".

question.text: With the help of one of the IT technicians, the missing accounting files have been _____ .

answer.explanation:
We need to fill in a past participle to complete the passive form of the verb in the present perfect: have been + past participle.
=> Choose D

question.text:
September 20
Ms. Amy Ellerson
Belgore Insurance Group
126 Sunrise Road
Teaneck, NJ 07666

Dear Ms. Ellerson:
Thank you for your purchase of 25 cases of premium paper from Bernstein Paper Products. Your online order was received on September 18 and is ready for shipping. (1) ______.
We appreciate that you have chosen to make the switch to Bernstein Paper Products for your company's paper needs. To show our gratitude, we are applying a 5 percent discount to this (2) ______ order. (3) ______, we are including a reimbursement of shipping charges. Enclosed please find the adjusted invoice and a check for $58.38.
Bernstein Paper Products is pleased (4) ______ you. We look forward to working with you in the future.

Sincerely,
Duri Yun
Lead Customer Service Representative
Enclosure
Your online order was received on September 18 and is ready for shipping. (1) ______.
choices: (A) Your years of continued patronage are truly valued.
(B) However, it seems that you have overpaid on your order.
(C) You may expect to receive your order in 5-7 business days.
(D) Unfortunately, we are writing to inform you of a delay in delivery.

answer.text: (C) You may expect to receive your order in 5-7 business days.
answer.explanation: The previous sentence mentions "Your online order was received on September 18 and is ready for shipping"

question.text: To show our gratitude, we are applying a 5 percent discount to this (2) ______ order.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words

question.text: (3) ______, we are including a reimbursement of shipping charges. Enclosed please find the adjusted invoice and a check for $58.38.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of conjunctions

question.text: Bernstein Paper Products is pleased (4) ______ you. We look forward to working with you in the future.

answer.explanation: be + adjective + to infinitive

question.text:
The Durham Fitness and Heath Expo (DFHE) is an international event that brings the fitness and health industries together for three days in one place, (1) ------- the perfect opportunity for these industries to showcase their products and services. The award-winning DFHE is now heading into its fifth year, and plans are in place to make it the largest and most diverse exposition (2) -------, with record numbers of the consumers and industry professionals expected to attend.
(3) -------. Both large and small booths in the vendor exhibition area are still available. Call 1 (800) 555-0156 for more information or to reverse your (4) -------.

The Durham Fitness and Heath Expo (DFHE) is an international event that brings the fitness and health industries together for three days in one place, (1) ------- the perfect opportunity for these industries to showcase their products and services.

answer.explanation: reduced relative clause. The full sentence is: "The Durham Fitness and Heath Expo (DFHE) is an international event that brings the fitness and health industries together for three days in one place, which provides the perfect opportunity .........

question.text: The award-winning DFHE is now heading into its fifth year, and plans are in place to make it the largest and most diverse exposition (2) -------,

answer.explanation: yet: the best, worst, etc. until now

question.text: (3) -------. Both large and small booths in the vendor exhibition area are still available.
choices: (A) The event will take place from August 6 to 8 at the Durham Convention Center.
(B) Changes to the schedule will be announced in the coming weeks.
(C) Most reviews of the event have been positive.
(D) It is not necessary to provide a credit card number at this time.

answer.text: (A) The event will take place from August 6 to 8 at the Durham Convention Center.
answer.explanation: Based on the following sentence which introduces "both large and small booths in the vendor exhibition area are still available" => this sentence is about the event's schedule

question.text: Call 1 (800) 555-0156 for more information or to reverse your (4) -------.

answer.explanation: reverse your space in the event => choose B

question.text: Come visit Wild Water Parks, your summer destination for family and friends of all ages. We have kiddie pools, we have outdoor pools, we have indoor pools, we have waves, and we have (1) _____ water slides, including our Death Fall, the largest slide in the state. We have everything for everyone in (2) _____group. Don't forget our delicious snack stands and restaurants. We also have gift shops and playgrounds. (3)_____ You can get tickets by calling 123-5555 or a season's pass for a (4) ______  of the price. Call now and experience the fun!
we have (1) _____ water slides, including our Death Fall, the largest slide in the state.

answer.explanation: Use an adjective in form of present participle to modify the noun "water slides"

question.text: We have everything for everyone in (2) _____group.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words

question.text: (3)_____ You can get tickets by calling 123-5555
choices: (A) The pools are the best place to stay.
(B) We even have a dog park for that furry companion of yours
(C) The chefs are top notch and the food is second to none.
(D) Hurry before the season is over and the promotion is finishes.

answer.text: (B) We even have a dog park for that furry companion of yours
answer.explanation: The entire passage is about "park" so B is the right answer.

question.text: You can get tickets by calling 123-5555 or a season’s pass for a (4)____ of the price.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words

question.text:
refer to the following e-mail

To: Henry Chan (h.chan@followmail.com)
From: Gleeson Consulting (hr@gleeson.com)
Date: March 14
Subject: Re: Application for project manager position

Dear Mr. Chan,

We received your application for project manager at Gleeson Consulting. The company had a large number of applicants, so (1)------- for the position was rather strong. I therefore regret to inform you that you have not been shortlisted for this post. (2) ___, we have closely examined your qualifications and consider you eligible for the project assistant position. (3)----

Interviews for this vacancy will take place on March 20 from 10 A.M. to 3 P.M. Please get in touch with me to let me know if you are interested in the job and can come in between these times. If you are not (4) ___ perhaps we can arrange a date that is more convenient for you.


Yours truly,

Jacqueline Hart
Human resources manager
Gleeson Consulting

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words.
a large number of applicants -> competition
Based on the the meaning of the previous sentence => need to fill a conjunction to show a contrast between the two events.

choices: (A)Some of the documents we requested were missing from your application.
(B)We do not have vacancies at this time, but may consider your application in the future.
(C)Your offer to find a suitable applicant was accepted.
(D)We hope you will consider being interviewed for this opening.

Based on the meaning of words.

question.text:

question.text:
Harrod Automotive Manufacturing
Andrew Dunn, Director
Laura Bradley, Site Manager
Welcome to Harrod Automotive Manufacturing! We are serious about maintaining a safe workplace environment. We ask that the following rules be strictly observed while you are touring the assembly floor. Anyone found in violation of these rules will be asked to leave the premises.
For concerns about compliance, please contact the site manager.
ALWAYS
+Stay with your tour guide.
+Wear safety glasses and helmet.
+Respond to alarm signals and obey evacuation instructions.
+Request permission from your guide before taking photographs.
NEVER:
+Leave your group.
+Enter areas marked “Danger” or “Staff Only.”
+Touch equipment.
For whom is the notice most likely intended?

question.text: According to the notice, why should someone contact Ms. Bradley?

answer.explanation: The last sentence of paragraph 1: For concerns about compliance, please contact the site manager. And the position of Mrs. Bradley has listed on line 3: Laura Bradley, Site Manager

question.text:
Attention Shoppers


We regret to inform you that there has been a general recall on all Kent brand ladders manufactured between March 30 and July 30 this year.

• The ladders do not comply with mandatory safety standards and could be unstable.
• The ladders could move while standing on them and could contribute to dangerous falls.
• Do not use the ladders for any reason. Contact the Kent Company to receive a refund or a replacement product. Customers will receive a full refund even without proof of purchase as long as they return the ladders.

The Kent Company can be reached by calling 1-800-555-2493. Press 8 in order to be transferred to a representative who deals exclusively with product recalls. We sincerely apologize for this inconvenience.
Where most likely could this notice be found?

answer.explanation:
Skim reading the whole article => remind, pay attention to using ladders

=> answer B is the most suitable

question.text: What are customers warned about?

answer.explanation:
- Consider the meaning of the bold paragraph containing information about the use of the ladder:

• The ladders do not comply with mandatory safety standards and could be unstable. 

• The ladders could move while standing on them and could contribute to dangerous falls.                     

• Do not use the ladders for any reason. Contact the Kent Company to receive a refund or a replacement product. Customers will receive a full refund even without proof of purchase as long as they return the ladders.          

=> 3 answers B, C & D are not mentioned in the article => choose A

question.text: According to the notice, how can more information be obtained?

answer.explanation:
- The second sentence, the third paragraph:  

"Contact the Kent Company to receive a refund or a replacement product."

- First sentence last paragraph: 

"The Company can be reached by Kent calling 1-800-555 2493."

question.text:
To: All Employees
From: Fred Hanes
Subject: Community Park Cleanup
Date: February 12

Joint Systems is a company that tries to take every opportunity to give back to our community. Therefore, I am urging all of our employees to take part in the upcoming community park cleanup sponsored by the city of Harrisburg. Without the dedication of volunteers, our parks and public spaces would not be free of litter. Donate some of your free time to keeping Harrisburg a beautiful and inviting city.
The community park cleanup will be held next Friday, February 18, from 1:00 to 5:00 P.M. Employees who wish to participate will leave work at lunchtime, yet will still be paid as if they had worked a full day. Volunteers are asked to bring supplies such as protective outerwear, tools, insect repellent, trash bags, and snacks.
A shuttle bus will depart from the company parking lot at 1:20 P.M. on Friday to take volunteers to the volunteer location. If you have a specific preference concerning the type of work you would like to do, please contact Event Organizer Don Lewis at 435- 555-6768.
We appreciate everyone’s enthusiasm and support.
Fred Hanes
Human Resources, Joint Systems
What is the purpose of the e-mail?

answer.explanation: The information is in: "Joint Systems is a company that tries to take every opportunity to give back to our community."

question.text: What would probably NOT be necessary for participants?

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "Volunteers are asked to bring supplies such as protective outerwear, tools, insect repellent, trash bags, and snacks."

question.text: According to the e-mail, what is Mr. Lewis responsible for?

answer.explanation: The information is in: "If you have a specific preference concerning the type of work you would like to do, please contact Event Organizer Don Lewis at 435- 555-6768."

question.text:
Frank’s Auto Repair 112 Central Avenue
Customer Feedback Form


Your opinions are important to us. We will use the information collected in this survey to help improve our service. Please tell us how important each of the following factors is to you when you choose a business for automotive reap air. Circle a number from 1-6.

@PS@/kstoeic/images/924467_1484793094795.png@PE@

I’m not sure I understand what was wrong with the car, but the mechanics were able to fix it quickly and easily. The price was reasonable, too. But it would be helpful next time if I could get more information about the repair.
What does the customer consider unimportant when choosing a repair service?

answer.explanation: At the category of "Convenient Location", customer mark 2 (not important level) => Choose A

question.text: With which aspect of the service was the customer NOT satisfied?
choices: (B)The amount of information given about the repair work
(C)The amount of time needed to make the repairs

answer.text: (B)The amount of information given about the repair work
answer.explanation: Customer marks "No" at "Clearly explain the work your vehicle needed" => Choose B

question.text: What is suggested about the customer?
choices: (A)The customer has been to the repair service more than once.
(B)The customer will not do business with Frank's Auto Repair again.
(C)The customer was satisfied with the repair costs.
(D)The customer knew what the problem was with the car.

answer.text: (C)The customer was satisfied with the repair costs.
answer.explanation: Customer marks "Yes" at "Tell you the cost before repairing your vehicle? => Choose C

question.text:
Ginger Lin [4:59] Just a reminder to everyone to please clear all your desks and shut down all electronic devices before you leave today. The floors will be polished and cleaned over the weekend.
Dimitri Roberts [5:00] Should we lock all the cabinets and drawers as well?
Ginger Lin [5:01] Yes. Please make sure that when the furniture is moved around, nothing falls out.
Dimitri Roberts [5:02] I'll make sure that everything is secure and locked before I leave. Janet Leigh [5:03] Ginger, I'm done with our budget reports. I'll have a copy e-mailed to you soon before I send them off.
Ginger Lin [5:04] Thank you; And Lance, you'll have to reschedule your meeting with your client tomorrow.
Lance Sibley [5:04] I've already rescheduled our meeting to the following Monday. And to be on the safe side in case our offices are not ready by then, we'll be meeting at a café not far from here.
Ginger Lin [5:05] Alright. It looks like most things are in order. Let me know if I missed anything.
Janet Leigh [5:06] Actually, not everyone sent me their overtime hours. I was still able to confirm through the sign-up sheets but I need everyone to confirm over e-mail before I send the payment forms to the Finance Department.
Dimitri Roberts [5:07] Oops, that's me. I'll send an e-mail now.
Karen Walker [5:07] Me too.
Janet Leigh [5:08] That's good. I can send the forms once I get your e-mails.
What will take place on Saturday and Sunday?

answer.explanation: Information was on the first message, “The floors will be polished and cleaned over the weekend.”

question.text: At 5:04, what does Lance Sibley mean by “to be on the safe side”?
choices: (A) The offices may not be safe.

answer.explanation: "to be on the safe side" means "to be safe, to be on the safe side", so the closest meaning to answer C.

question.text: Who most likely is Ginger Lin?

answer.explanation: Ginger is the one who reminds everyone to clean the table; turn off the electrical equipment and prompt Lance to reschedule the customer and receive a budget report from Janet. So this is most likely the manager.

question.text: What will Janet Leigh most likely do next?

answer.explanation: The message at 5:06, Janet said that everyone has not yet sent out the confirmation email, and then two people said that they would send it. So it can be inferred that the next thing she does is check her email.

question.text:
Filiz Budak, 8:30 A.M.
Hello all, Once again when I opened up the shop earlier today, all the lights were on. Does anyone know how that happened?
Luke Ciccone, 8:33 A.M.
I set the timer right before locking the door yesterday afternoon. The lights should have shut off at 6 P.M.
Analia Rue, 8:35 A.M.
I drove by the store on my way home from the post office around 6:30, and the lights were off.
Filiz Budak, 8:37 A.M.
OK. Since this has happened the last three mornings, there's definitely a problem with the timer.
Jae Woo Han, 8:38 A.M.
I left with Luke at 5 and saw him set the timer.
Luke Ciccone, 8:42 A.M.
I agree. The lights are turning on before they are scheduled to. I'll call a repair service when I get to work for my shift. Rex Repair is always reliable.
Filiz Budak, 8:48 A.M.
Contact the company that did the installation. The paperwork should be in one of the filing cabinets. And until the timer can be fixed, the last person on duty will have to turn off each light before closing.
Jae Woo Han, 8:50 A.M.
Yes, I remember filling their invoice at the time of the installation.
Luke Ciccone, 8:51 A.M.
Will do.
What is most likely true about Ms. Budak?
choices: (A) She works in a post office.

answer.explanation:
On the first message, Ms. Budak said that she opened her shop this morning, so it is likely that she works the morning shift.
In addition, it can be seen that the information in options A, B and C is not correct. So the correct answer is D.

question.text: Who was the last person to see that the lights were off?

answer.explanation: From the milestones in the message text, it can be seen that Ms. Rue was the last person to see the lights go out at 6:30 passing by.

question.text: At 8:42 A.M., what does Mr. Ciccone most likely mean when he writes, "I agree"?
choices: (A) He believes that the timer needs to be fixed.
(B) He plans to follow Ms. Budak's instructions.
(C) He thinks that Rex Repair is a trusted repair service.
(D) He knows that Mr. Han saw him set the timer.

answer.text: (A) He believes that the timer needs to be fixed.
answer.explanation: After the sentence "I agree", Mr. Ciccone continues that "The lights are turning on before they are scheduled to" (The light is on before the time it is scheduled). That means he is expressing his consent to Ms. Budak's message regarding this content “there's definitely a problem with the timer”

question.text: What is the first thing Mr. Ciccone will most likely do when he arrives at works?

answer.explanation: At 8:42 Mr. Ciccone texted that he would call Rex Repair when he got to work, but then Ms. Budak said to contact the installation company and the papers in the closet file. So maybe when he gets to work, Mr. Ciccone will look in the filing drawer to find installation papers to call for repair.

question.text:
Crockett Center for Community Dewetopment
28 Freeney Avenue
Austin, TX 73301



May 16

Dathan Shaw, Urban Outreach Director
Integral Harvest
184 Van Buren Street
Denver, CO 80210

Dear Mr. Shaw:

I enjoyed our meeting last week. I know of no other non-profit organization that performs such a vital service for all-natural agriculture as yours does, and I am enthusiastic about the prospect of the Crocket Center working with Integral Harvest.

As you know, the Crockett Center has recently turned its attention to urban gardening. On this front, the main priorities are to expand existing community gardens in Austin and to found new ones in neighborhoods currently lacking them. Therefore, I would like to proceed with the gardening classes we discussed in our meeting, to be taught on-site by Integral Harvest representatives and attended by Austin community residents. If you will let me know your representatives' availability for teaching the classes and also the range of topics they will cover, I can prepare a class schedule and generate interest in it among residents. My assistant, Cindy Reed, will call you shortly for this information.

As for your proposal that Integral Harvest representatives demonstrate organic gardening to elementary school students here in Austin, since our meeting I have spoken with several school administrators. It seems that a number of the schools have gardening clubs, so students and teachers alike should make a receptive audience. Let us discuss this proposal further in our next meeting, which Ms. Reed will schedule.

I am sure that, if our two organizations work together, we can do much to promote urban gardening as a rewarding and healthful endeavor.

Yours sincerely,

Letitia Price, Executive Director
Crockett Center for Community Development
What is the purpose of the letter?
choices: (A)To arrange a joint project between two organizations
(C)To provide a schedule of gardening classes
(D)To finalize a merger of two organizations

answer.text: (A)To arrange a joint project between two organizations
answer.explanation: Based on the information given in: "I know of no other non-profit organization that performs such a vital service for all-natural agriculture as yours does, and I am enthusiastic about the prospect of the Crocket Center working with Integral Harvest."

question.text: What is stated as one of the Crockett Center's goals?
choices: (B)To increase attendance at gardening club meetings

answer.explanation: The information is in: "On this front, the main priorities are to expand existing community gardens in Austin and to found new ones in neighborhoods currently lacking them."

question.text: What subject was most likely discussed when Mr. Shaw and Ms. Price met?
choices: (C)A government proposal to build new schools

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "Therefore, I would like to proceed with the gardening classes we discussed in our meeting, to be taught on-site by Integral Harvest representatives and attended by Austin community residents."

question.text: Why will Ms. Reed contact Mr. Shaw?
choices: (A)To give him contact information for school administrators
(B)To postpone a meeting until the following week
(D)To ask him about a new gardening method

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "As for your proposal that Integral Harvest representatives demonstrate organic gardening to elementary school students here in Austin, since our meeting I have spoken with several school administrators. It seems that a number of the schools have gardening clubs, so students and teachers alike should make a receptive audience. Let us discuss this proposal further in our next meeting, which Ms. Reed will schedule."

question.text:
To: Tony Walker - twalker@icmcorp.com
From: Suzie Mason smason@icmcorp.com
Date: May 4
Subject: Summer Calendar
Attachment: budget.doc

Dear Mr. Walker,

I am finalizing the calendar of summer events for our company. Because we went over budget last year on employee appreciation events, I think it would be wise to find more affordable recreational activities. Attached is a breakdown of projected expenses for summer events that I have planned.
July 6: Anchorage Flower Festival
July 22: Art in the Park at Lawrence Park
August 6: Bicycle Tours of the Anchorage Countryside
August 19: Horseback Riding at Sweet Meadow Ranch
I have scheduled fewer outdoor activities this year compared to last year. This year I would like to take advantage of a new outdoor recreational opportunity that I read about on the Anchorage Reporter website. You can read the article by clicking on this link:
www.anchoragereporter.com/new_trails.
Please let me know your opinion,
Suzie Mason
Human Resources Manager

===========================


 

Anchorage Reporter

Bike Tours of the Anchorage Countryside to Start August 6


May 2—The Anchorage Bike Club will be hosting an annual bike riding event this summer, beginning on August 6 and running through August 7. The event will start at 10:00 A.M. on both days at the Anchorage Community Center. If you are driving a vehicle to the starting point, it would be better to use the parking lot behind the community center.

Anchorage Bike Club President Jean Frost stated, “The rides will range from 5 to 20 miles and will take bikers through scenic areas in Anchorage. Overall, the bike tours will go ahead at a leisurely pace so that bikers of all skill levels can participate. However, local bikers with ample experience might lead a faster-paced group.”

Bikers in the tours will learn about riding techniques, bicycle maintenance, and proper nutrition half an hour before the event starts. All participants must have biking helmets on. They are also encouraged to bring their own water to prevent dehydration while biking.

==========================

 

BICYCLE TOUR SIGN-UP SHEET


If you intend to participate in the August 6 bicycle tour, please write down your name, department, and level of experience or fitness. If we have enough people sign up as advanced, we can coordinate two separate tours. If there are not enough for two tours, we would like to encourage all riders to stay together so that everyone can join in the team building exercises we have planned. Thank you for your participation and we look forward to seeing everyone at the event!


 
Name Department Fitness/experience
Tom Cruz Sales Beginer
Vin Jones Inventory Beginner
Sally Jenkins Inventory Beginner
Barbara Blaster Reception Advanced
Hope Kinski Sales Beginner
What does Ms. Mason suggest doing?
choices: (A) Keeping within a budget for recreational activities
(B) Appointing a new manager of human resources
(C) Increasing the number of temporary employees
(D) Scheduling more outdoor activities compared to last year

answer.text: (A) Keeping within a budget for recreational activities
answer.explanation: “Because we went over budget last year on employee appreciation events, I think it would be wise to find more affordable recreational activities ”.

question.text: What date does Ms. Mason suggest for this year’s new activity?

answer.explanation:
“This year I would like to take advantage of a new door recreational opportunity that I read about on the Anchorage Reporter website.”

“The Anchorage Bike Club will be hosting an annual bike riding event this summer, beginning on August 6 and running through August 7.”

question.text: In what section of the website would the article most likely appear?

answer.explanation: The article talks about the bike race. -> personal preferences -> select B

question.text: Based upon the Bicycle Tour Sign-up Sheet, what can we infer about the upcoming bicycle tour?
choices: (B) There will be two groups, one for beginners, one for advanced.
(C) There will be only one group.
(D) They will stop along the way for a group meal and photo.

answer.text: (C) There will be only one group.
answer.explanation: “If there are not enough for two tours, we would like to encourage all riders to stay together so that everyone can join in the team building exercises we have planned.”

question.text: What will Barbara Blaster most likely do on the bicycle tour?
choices: (A) She will become bored and quit the tour.
(B) She will complain that more people should sign up as advanced.
(C) She will join a faster-paced group of more experienced bikers.
(D) She will stay with the group to participate in group activities.

answer.text: (D) She will stay with the group to participate in group activities.
answer.explanation: A look at the registration panel found that Barbara Blaster was the only one who signed up for the advanced group. However, she still stayed and grafted groups to engage with people.

question.text:
Midcity Performing Arts Hall

Support the Midcity Performing Arts Hall in downtown Brenton by becoming a member. You can choose from the following membership plans:
General - For only $100, you can get a full-year membership to attend any two performing arts shows that have available seats in the D area of the theater.
Silver - For a fee of $200, you can attend any two performing arts shows that have available seats in the B area of the theater.
Gold - For a fee of $500, you will receive early alerts of popular programs with a ticket to any two performing arts shows with seats in the B area, and a guaranteed seat for any show of your choice within a one-year period in the front row section.
Diamond - For a fee of $1000, you will have exclusive access to signed autographs with performing arts stars, invitations to two exclusive pre-showings of popular programs, and a guaranteed seat for any show of your choice within a one-year period in the VIP section.
*Some restrictions may apply.
*Admissions to orchestral performances excluded

=============================

To:bates@midcityarthall.com
From:Alicia Norton
Date:January 16
Subject:Membership

Thank you for the e-mail about the Midcity Performing Arts Hall membership. I have attached a fee of $1000.1 was a general member last year and I enjoyed a couple of the musicals that were performed. I have become a theater enthusiast since the experience and I look forward to the benefits of the new membership plan.
By the way, the Art Hall has done a phenomenal job on the renovations to the building. I'm excited to come back this year.

===========================

@PS@/kstoeic/images/4448661_1564544782006.png@PE@
Which membership did Alicia Norton most likely purchase?

answer.explanation: In the email, Alica Norton said there was a $ 1000 fee attached. According to the advertisement, this is the diamond membership fee, so this is likely the type of member she bought the most.

question.text: What is meant by the expression “some restrictions may apply”?
choices: (A)Only certain people will be considered for membership.
(B)The membership plans may change without notice.
(C)Not all performances are available to members.

answer.text: (C)Not all performances are available to members.
answer.explanation: "some restrictions may apply", meaning a number of shows will be limited to members. So the most suitable answer is C.

question.text: When is a performance not free to members?

answer.explanation: In the note of the ad, “Admissions to orchestral performances excluded ”, means that members are not allowed to enter free symphonies. The scheduled symphony is scheduled for January.

question.text: What is suggested about the Midcity Performing Arts Hall?
choices: (B)It had some changes made to the building.
(C)It is a place popular among celebrities.

answer.text: (B)It had some changes made to the building.
answer.explanation: Info is located near the bottom of the email "the Art Hall has done a phenomenal job on the renovations to the building"

question.text: What is implied about the schedule?

answer.explanation: As can be seen from the "Tentative schedule" heading, this means that the schedule is changeable.

question.text:
To:Bountiful Harvest info@bountifulharvest.com
From:Emily Hall emilyhall@zipline.com
Date:June 3
Subject: Food Delivery

To whom it may concern,

My name is Emily Hall and I am the owner of a vegetarian restaurant located in downtown Huntsville. I am contacting you because I am interested in receiving regular shipments of fresh, organic vegetables to my restaurant weekly. My restaurant is just starting, so I do not need a large quantity of goods. After looking into different farms in the area, I chose to contact Bountiful Harvest because of your promise to deliver certified organic food. Therefore, I would like to receive a price estimate for the cost of having fresh vegetables delivered directly to our restaurant on a weekly basis.

Emily Hall

==========================

To:Emily Hall emilyhall@zipline.com
From:Bountiful Harvest info@bountifulharvest.com
Date:June 4
Subject:RE: Food Delivery

Dear Ms. Hall,

Thanks for contacting our farm. At Bountiful Harvest, we offer fresh organic produce that can be delivered directly to a customer’s location on a regular basis. Our vegetables are harvested from the field and delivered immediately, which means that you are getting wholesome, nutritious, organic produce to serve at your restaurant. We also offer additional items such as fresh meat, cheese, and milk. Below is a table detailing the various pricing options we offer.

Package Option Features Weight Delivery Frequency Price Per Delivery
Personal This package feeds approximately 2-3 people and contains fresh seasonal vegetables 5 lb Once a week $15
Small This package is ideal for small businesses and includes fresh seasonal vegetables. 50 lb Once a week $140
Medium This package is for medium-sized businesses needing a constant supply of fresh vegetables and meats. 130 lb Twice a week $500
Large This package is our largest package and includes vegetables, meats, and dairy products. 250 lb Twice a week $800


The prices listed above do not include the delivery price. Customers who do not pick up their packages in person will have to pay an extra $6 per package to be delivered. However, for customers who sign up for an entire year’s worth of deliveries, we will deliver your package for free. The purchase of additional items will also affect the final price of your package. Additional options are available on our website. Payments can be made via cash, credit card, check, or money order on the day of delivery.

We know that our customers especially care about the quality of the food. Therefore, we offer a mini package free of charge so you can assess our food. Please call Greg Lemons at 555-8141 to take advantage of this opportunity.

Indira Singh

===========================

To: Bountiful Harvest info@bountifulharvest.com
From: Emily Hall emilyhall@zipline.com
Date: June 5
Subject: Harvest Schedule

Dear Ms. Singh,

Thank you for responding so promptly to my email. I appreciate the offer of the complimentary delivery, but I think I would like to just go ahead and set up regular deliveries. I may be interested in setting up a year’s worth of deliveries, but I would first like to get a list of the range of produce that you will be offering through the different seasons. As I own a vegetarian restaurant, I will need to have an idea of the types of produce that will be delivered so I can prepare my menus accordingly. Thank you so much for your consideration, and I look forward to working with Bountiful Harvest!

Kind regards,
Emily Hall
What is the purpose of the first e-mail?
choices: (B) To inquire about a policy change

answer.explanation: “Therefore, I would like to receive a price estimate for the cost of having fresh vegetables delivered directly to our restaurant on a weekly basis.”

question.text: Why does Emily Hall want to know about the vegetables that will be available throughout the year?
choices: (B) She is thinking about adding meat.
(D) She wants to plan her future menus

answer.text: (D) She wants to plan her future menus
answer.explanation: “I will need to have an idea of the types of produce that will be delivered so I can prepare my menus accordingly”

question.text: What information is not needed for a final price?

answer.explanation:
By the exclusion method, it can be seen that only information in option C was not mentioned.
Option A: for customers who sign up for an entire year's worth of deliveries, we will deliver your package for free ”
Option B:“ Customers who do not pick their packages in person will have to pay an extra $ 6 per package to be delivered '
Option C “The purchase of additional items will also affect the final price of your package”

question.text: What package option most likely fits Ms. Hall’s needs best?

answer.explanation:
“My restaurant is just starting” and “having fresh vegetables delivered directly to our restaurant on a weekly basis”.
The optional package that covers these most is the Small package.

question.text: What is indicated in Emily Hall’s e-mail?
choices: (A) She wants to try it for a month.
(C) She is interested in a long-term contract.

answer.text: (C) She is interested in a long-term contract.
answer.explanation:
“I appreciate the offer of the complimentary delivery”
“I may be interested in setting up a year's worth of deliveries”

question.text:
To: Library Members - members@claytonlibrary.edu
From: Holly Allen - hollyallen@claytonlibrary.edu
Subject: Events This Month
Date: August 1
Attachment: August Event Calendar

Dear Members of the Clayton Library,
Thank you for your continued support of the Clayton Library. Your monthly membership fees help US to obtain new books, computers, journal subscriptions, and other resources that are useful to the entire community. We would like to inform you of some special upcoming events this month you may be interested in attending.
First, famous children's book author and storyteller Ebert Butler will be visiting our library. He will be reading from his new book, The Mysterious Cat, and signing autographs. His book was recently nominated for the Children's Book of the Year Award. Kathy Butler, Mr. Butler's wife, will also be in attendance at this event. She has drawn the pictures in most of Mr. Butler's books, including The Mysterious Cat. This event costs $10 but is provided free for library members.
Later in the month, renowned wildlife photographer Nina Brooks will be holding an exhibition on the main floor of the library. Ms. Brooks recently returned from a trip to Kenya, where she photographed cheetahs, giraffes, elephants, and other animals. Her photographs capture the vividness of the wildlife and the majesty of nature.
In addition to these two featured events, there will be a variety of workshops, games nights, and other events this month. Check the attached calendar for details. All events, including Movie Night, are free unless noted otherwise.

Sincerely,
Holly Allen
Library Events Coordinator

==============================

Clayton Library Events Calendar
August
 
Date/Time Event Title Notes
Saturday, Aug. 2, 5:00 P.M. Creative Writers Workshop Led by Donna Ward
Friday, Aug. 8, 7:00 P.M. Movie Night Family-friendly event Entrance
Sunday, Aug. 17, 6:00 PM. The Mysterious Cat Reading Entrance cost of $10
Wednesday, Aug. 20, 3:00 P.M. Knitting Club Complimentary refreshments
Saturday, Aug. 30, 2:00 P.M. Photo Exhibition Opening Entrance cost of $5


==============================
 
Clayton Library Community Chat Board

August 1
> User ID: Jjohnson231
Subject: Creative Writers Workshop August 2
Hey, is anybody going to go to the writers workshop tomorrow? I heard that Donna Ward is an outstanding teacher. I could really use some feedback on my latest short story too. Post if you are going! -Jim

> User ID: Storytimechuck
Subject: Re: Creative Writers Workshop August 2
Hey jjohnson231! I am going for sure. You are right, Donna is the best. Her knowledge of narrative and pacing have really helped me with my screenplay. Maybe I could read through your short story after the workshop and give you my feedback too? The more eyes the better, I always say! I'll let you take a look through my screenplay too if you are interested. See you tomorrow! -Chuck- /hollyallen@claytonlibrary.edu/members@claytonlibrary.edu
When can library users meet Kathy Butler?

answer.explanation: Kathy Butler is Butler's wife and will come along with him. According to the timetable, Butler has a reading session on The Mysterious Cat on Sunday. So it can be inferred that it is possible to meet Ms. Kathy Butler on Sunday.

question.text: What is indicated about Ebert Butler?
choices: (B) He has recently published his first book.
(D) He will receive an award soon.

answer.explanation: You can see the information in the sentence “Kathy Butler, Mr. Butler's wife, will also be in attendance at this event. She has drawn the pictures in most of Mr. Butler's books, including The Mysterious Cat ”

question.text: What will likely happen after the Creative Writers Workshop on August 2?
choices: (A) Everyone will know how to write poetry better.
(B) Chuck and Jim will exchange their work to give each other feedback.
(C) Donna Ward will publish her novel.
(D) Chuck and Donna will work with Jim’s short story.

answer.text: (B) Chuck and Jim will exchange their work to give each other feedback.
answer.explanation: During the chat, Chuck wrote “Maybe I could read through your short story after the workshop and give you my feedback too? ... I'll let you take a look through my screenplay too if you are interested”

question.text: What is the purpose of the e-mail?

answer.explanation: The purpose of the email is on the sentence “We would like to inform you of some special upcoming events this month you may be interested in attending.”

question.text: According to the chat board, what does Donna Ward excel at?
choices: (C) Understanding the role of timing and storylines

answer.text: (C) Understanding the role of timing and storylines
answer.explanation: It can be inferred from the phrase "Her knowledge of narrative and pacing have really helped me with my screenplay."

question.text:
Rural Community Outreach Program


As part of its ongoing commitment to enhance the standard of living in rural communities across the state,' the Institute of Rural Service provides annual grants for rural communities. The goal of this program is to support local efforts to sustain a convenient and satisfying life in the countryside. The grants available this year are as follows:

Business Development Grant: $250,000
Community Development Grant: $150,000
Communications Development Grant: $200,000
Educational Development Grant: $100,000
The institute will give priority to proposals that reflect a comprehensive approach to community development, promote community engagement, and make rural communities a better place to live and work. The grants will allow rural communities to take the first step toward a project or plan that can help improve the lives of rural community members. For the past decades, the grants have been used for a variety of purposes such as state-of- the-art farming equipment, road maintenance, communications infrastructure, educational facilities, and investments for young rural entrepreneurs.
Download this application to apply for a grant. The deadline for submission is February 28.

===========================

Village of Cranton Wins Funding


CRANTON, March 22—The Institute of Rural Service announced today that the village of Cranton is this year’s recipient of the Educational Development Grant. The grant will be used to fund the construction of a large playground that will provide recreational activities for children under 12. Since the opening of the new electronics factory last year, the number of families in the area has risen dramatically. As a result, children have been left with less and less space to play in. The new playground will allow children to play and enjoy themselves when they are not at school.

Cranton is proud to be the recipient of this grant and plans to apply for more grants in the future to improve the living conditions of the town and attract more residents
What is the purpose of the web page?
choices: (A) To report that a project has been completed
(B) To encourage applications for a grant
(C) To announce a recipient of a grant

answer.text: (B) To encourage applications for a grant
answer.explanation:
- Last line:

"Download this application to apply for a grant. The deadline for submission is February 28"

question.text: According to the web page, what is NOT mentioned as a purpose of an Institute of Rural Service grant?
choices: (A) Providing funds for local business people
(B) Building the basic systems for communications

answer.explanation:
Paragraph 3 (after bold):

"The institute will give priority to proposal that reflect a comprehensive approach to community development, promote community engagement, and make rural communities a better place to live and work. The grants will allow rural communities to take the first step toward a project or plan that can help improve the lives of rural community members. For the past decades, the grants have been used for a variety of purposes such as state of- the art farming equipment, road maintenance, communications infrastructure, educational             
 facilities, and investments for young rural entrepreneurs. "

question.text: How much funding did Cranton receive?

answer.explanation:
- The first sentence, paragraph 1 of the article (article): CRANTON, March 22 - The Institute of Rural Service announced today that the village of Cranton is this year's recipient of the Educational Development Grant.

Educational Development Grant: $ 100,000
 => choose answer A

question.text: According to the article, what will the grant enable Cranton to do?
choices: (D) Provide a play area for children

answer.text: (D) Provide a play area for children
answer.explanation:
- The second sentence, paragraph 1 of the article:

"The grant will be used to fund the construction of a large playground that will provide recreational activities for children under 12."

question.text: What is indicated about Cranton?
choices: (A) It has received grants in the past.
(B) It plans to open a new factory.
(D) It will hold a community festival.

answer.explanation: The third sentence, paragraph 1 of the article: "Since the opening of the new electronics factory last year, the number of families in the area has risen dramatically."
